required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anatomical Location and Metastasis Pattern of Intrapulmonary Lymph Nodes in NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: Anatomical Location and Metastasis Pattern of Intrapulmonary Lymph Nodes in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer: a Multi-center, Prospective Observational Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Anatomical Location and Metastasis Pattern of Intrapulmonary Lymph Nodes (Group 11-13) in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer: a Multi-center, Prospective observational Clinical Trial

detailed_description.textblock: Patients would be evaluated whether meet the criteria as clinical stage T1 non-small Cell Lung Cancer. Then, he/she would receive lobectomy. Finally, the detailed anatomical location of group 11-13 would be recorded immediately after surgery and their metastasis pattern would be explored in the follow-up period.

primary_outcome.description: metastasis rate of intrapulmonary lymph nodes (group 11-13 LN) in non-small cell lung cancer

secondary_outcome.description: number of group 11-13 intrapulmonary lymph nodes in Non-small cell lung cancer and their detailed anatomical location

arm_group.description: patients who recieved the resection of right upper lobe (RUL)
patients who recieved the resection of right middle lobe ()
patients who recieved the resection of right lower lobe (RML)
patients who recieved the resection of left upper lobe (LUL)
patients who recieved the resection of left lower lobe (LLL)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with stage T1 peripheral non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) undergoing radical lobectomy

overall_official.affiliation: Fudan University Affiliated Shanghai Cancer Center

patient_data.ipd_description: Study Protocol, Inform Consent Form, Clinical Study Report would be shared every 3 months after the study begin.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: every 3 months after the study begin.
